article_title: NYC Police to Question Man Involved in Deadly Subway Shooting
article_text:
A retired New York City correction officer told police he identified himself as an “officer” during a dispute with two other men and told them they would be arrested before he shot and killed one of them in a Brooklyn subway station, authorities said Wednesday.

The retired officer, William Groomes, said Gilbert Drogheo, 32 years old, of Harlem, and Joschelyn Everingan, 28, of Brooklyn, began verbally harassing him when he walked between them on a southbound No. 4 train during the Tuesday evening rush hour, the New York...
